intro: Psychotria malaneoides var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-leaved Psychotria, is a species native to tropical regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its leaves are usually smooth and glossy, with a lanceolate shape, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. While not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles.
